this is atea or better known as great barrier 
island because that's what captain cook called

it on his voyages here because it acts 
as a barrier between the pacific ocean

and the haraki gulf and while it's only 62 miles 
from the modern city center of auckland it feels

like a land far far away a lush sanctuary of maori 
ancestral land that is completely off the grid

so naturally life here moves slower and requires a 
certain amount of self-reliance which is probably

why we're loving it so much it's a familiar rhythm 
similar to life on our floating home connected to

both the modern and natural world aware of our 
mutual relationship and always seeking balance

it's just been wind wind and more wind that's all
